content:
Thoughts on the new "narrow to first topic when you click on a stream"? Options include "I didn't notice it until you mentioned it" :).

My current opinion is that I like automatically going to a topic narrow when there are new messages, but I want the stream narrow when there are not.
(Also, double clicking on a stream name doesn't work well for several reasons, though that can maybe be fixed by having shift+click or something go directly to the stream narrow.)

Oh that's what it was. I noticed something weird going on (narrowing to a topic) when I started clicking on streams today. In my opinion I like it better if it doesn't narrow at all, because then I can easily see all the messages in that stream, because after all that's what I clicked the stream for.
^ Same opinion.
I actually thought it was a bug. I too liked the old behaviour much better.
I like the new feature, because before this, it was hard to know which messages were unread when I got dumped into the interleaved view. I like the shift-click idea.
I strongly dislike it. There is nothing special about the first unread narrow, that I would narrow to it exclusively!
@Jerry Zhang @Vishnu Ks @Boris Yankov What are your thoughts on ways to accomodate users who want to enter a stream without being dumped into an interleaved view?

Long term I see something like this that we will have in the mobile app:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/pull/1012
I will actually resume working on it this week and should have it within a couple of weeks in the mobile app.

Short-term I just suggest reverting the behavior.
Even if a user does want to go to a specific topic, this does not successfully do that, as it narrows to the first topic, not the one that the user wants anyways.

Another option, using this device to determine where to auto-narrow :)
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tanttle/emotiv-insight-optimize-your-brain-fitness-and-per
To extend the analogy, when clicking Home, you want Home, not the first topic of the first stream.

@Boris Yankov Just to clarify, I might not want to go to a specific topic when I open a stream. I just want to open the stream and not have a bunch of messages get read that I have to act upon. It's bad enough to be dumped into 1 topic. If we revert this I get dumped into N topics, and in the middle of them maybe.
Then the approach we are going to use in the mobile app will be even more relevant
There should be a way to get a more in-depth overview of what is going on without necessarily being in 'read and mark as read' mode
I also liked the previous version. Or can we have a toggle option in setting (may be in Zulip labs) to switch between this two behaviours?

okay, we should revert it for now. I think the current behavior is quite confusing for new users, though, so we do need a solution to this.

I think #M1012 feels natural for mobile, but not sure it will work for desktop.
@Rishi Gupta sometimes the hard choices and lots of thinking companies put into designing for mobile translate very well for Desktop too, even though the limitations there are less
The main inspiration for our design is Google Inbox, and the mobile UI for Inbox is almost 100% the same for the web/desktop and it works very well.
From what you are seeing in the screenshot prototypes we might move a bit to make it more Inbox-y.

I agree with the general point, though I think the cards thing works particularly well for mobile. Slack also does the "All unreads" view with cards (on desktop), and I don't particularly like it on Slack.

But I haven't used Inbox (or seen it on desktop); happy to try it when we get there.

Inbox is one of the examples for great UI rework of a well known UI - it replaces GMail, which is a huge task considering how much people are used to the previous design. It sure takes a few days to get used to Inbox but still, great job by the devs.

This is a bit unrelated but, we should be careful about adding too many shortcuts I think. If something needs a special shortcut, we might instead focus on finding out some better way to directly access it.
The shift+click thing for example.
Another option here is to add "Go to most recent topic" in the popover.
That would be a short-term solution of my problem of simply wanting to see a stream's topics without being dumped into N topics at once.
BTW, double clicking works fine for me. Not a good way, but I would like to add a 'double click' listener here cause the functionality looks good?
In the time between clicking and expansion animation, if you click again, it takes you to the stream narrow.

To summarize some proposed workarounds:

  • shift-click avoids interleaved
  • have a setting so users can choose
  • add an option to the popover menu
  • go to cards approach (long term)
  • advanced telepathy :wink:
I am for telepathy way more than for settings ;) Assume that 98% of people will not change the setting and design for that. So that does not free us from choosing a good default
